headline.print_headline: Weight-Loss Drug to Be Sold Over the Counter
headline.main: Weight-Loss Drug to Be Sold Over the Counter

docs.lead_paragraph: The drug, called Alli, is expected to be available to consumers this summer.
docs.snippet: The drug, called Alli, is expected to be available to consumers this summer.

headline.print_headline: Looking Beyond the Runway for Answers on Underweight Models
headline.main: Looking Beyond the Runway for Answers on Underweight Models

docs.lead_paragraph: This is far from the first time that models have been singled out, and moralized about, as potentially unhealthy and somehow inherently bad.
docs.snippet: This is far from the first time that models have been singled out, and moralized about, as potentially unhealthy and somehow inherently bad.

headline.print_headline: Bush’s 2008 Budget Would Raise Some Medicare Premiums
headline.main: Bush’s Medicare Budget Would Raise Premiums

docs.lead_paragraph:
More Medicare recipients would pay higher premiums for coverage of drugs and doctors’ visits under
the president’s 2008 budget.
docs.snippet:
More Medicare recipients would pay higher premiums for coverage of drugs and doctors’ visits under
the president’s 2008 budget.

docs.abstract: As President Bush seeks to eliminate the federal budget deficit by 2012, his new budget proposal includes trimming $70 billion from Medicare and Medicaid over five years.
docs.lead_paragraph: Social Security gets all the attention, but the real budget busters among the entitlement programs are Medicare and Medicaid, which cover more than 1 in 4 Americans.
docs.snippet: As President Bush seeks to eliminate the federal budget deficit by 2012, his new budget proposal includes trimming $70 billion from Medicare and Medicaid over five years.
